alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 9:25AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Summers and northern Mercer Counties through 1030 AM EDT... At 924 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wenonah, or 9 miles north of Matoaka, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hinton... Pipestem... Camp Creek... Sandstone... Camp Creek State Park... Buck... and Flat Top. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
